result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad Wayne Sanderson

records.addlTxt:
9:29 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Chad Wayne Sanderson in court. Atty Scott Selmer in court for DE. INCLUDES 22CM331 and 22CM508 (INIT). 22CM508: Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. NG. ADA Ballo requests bond. Atty. Selmer makes bond argument. Court sets bond. Court sets PSC and SETC. Adjourned: 9:38 AM. kma
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Settlement conference scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Settlement conference on November 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

AMENDED

INCLUDES 22CM331 and 22CM508

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Sydney Magneson and Willow River Inn. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least TWO times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
Order for payment on August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
FOR ATTY FEES. DE to pay $100/mo comm 7/30/22. PPF waived. DE signed Pet for Appt of Atty & will be mailed an Order for Pymt. kma
Signed by SJN on 06/22/22. Appointing Atty Selmer. Repayment rate of $100.00 per month starting 07/30/22. arc
from JA to DE and Atty Selmer. Appointing Counsel. Repayment rate of $100.00 per month starting 07/30/22. arc

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency
